title: Skill
description: Skills represent somethings a character can learn. like healing. This differs them from conditions that are normally obtained trough play. Traditionally skills provide positive effect and enable the character to do stuff he or she otherwise couldnâ€™t (like casting spells). Skills normally also come with an cost (in terms of experience points).

id.description: The unique identifier for this skill

description.description: The description of this skill. Should not contain the technical effect of the skill but rather a more setting like description.
description.example: Healers are what keeps the party going, when some one goes done a healer make sure the get back up again.

effect.description: The technical description of what the skill does, you can stuff al your rule book stuff right here.
effect.example: Character has access to level 1 healing spells

effects.description: A list of effects that apply to a character that take this skill

setting.description: The setting that this skill belongs to

requiredSkills.description: Any required skills that a character should have before it can take this skill

requiredAbillities.description: Any required abbilities that a character should have before it can take this skill

requiredConditions.description: Any required conditions that a character should have before it can take this skill

requiredEffects.description: Any required effects that a character should have before it can take this skill

requiredScore.description: Only applies when the requirement object is one ore more abillitties. Indicates the minimum score a character should have before this skill can be selected.

cumulative.description: Determines if a character can take this skill more then once
